page.title: 15BASSINGBOURN'S ROYAL EVENT
page.content: The Hon. Oliver Walston came to see us and show some slides of Ethiopia. He said that they were using roads that would have been rivers. We made a display for a Save the Children exhibition in Cambridge which Princess Anne visited. The exhibition was about having enough water to grow the crops. We grew some wheat in poor conditions then we grew some wheat in the conditions here. We made a model of a British farm and an Ethiopian farm to show the difference. When Julie and I were standing by our exhibit talking to Princess Anne all these camera-men came up to ask us questions. When Andrew and I went to see Princess Anne I felt quite scared. When Princess Anne spoke to us she said "Did you do Ethiopia as a whole or as part?" I said "As a whole." { by Andrew, Julie, Mark & Rachael.
